intro: Calandrinia monogyna, commonly known as the pink rock-gourd, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are succulent and often tinged with red. Calandrinia monogyna is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
